isly ilwott

The 2nd Amendment is available to ALL.
 
 
 NRA-ILA :: U.S. Senate Votes to Uphold Second Amendment in Washington, D.C.
 
 Fairfax, Va. - The United States Senate has voted, with overwhelming bipartisan support, to adopt an amendment offered by Senator John Ensign (R-NV) that seeks to protect the Second Amendment rights of law-abiding citizens in the District of Columbia. The amendment, attached to S.160, the D.C. Voting Rights Act, will repeal restrictive gun control laws passed by the District of Columbia's (D.C.) city council after the landmark D.C. v. Heller Supreme Court decision. The vote margin was 62-36.

Great that the senate woke up and did the correct thing. Now what are the chances of the house following along with it? How about the guy who is for good, common sense, gun control signing it into law? Of course his definition of good, common sense, gun control is pre-Heller DC total ban.

There is no reason to believe that it will lead to a lower crime rate. Gun activists just want us to assume they are correct without evidence. I'm not falling for that. In fact, D.C. has experienced some of its greatest decreases in crime while the ban has been in effect and had some of its highest crime rates before the ban took effect. Some examples:
 
 data from the FBI UCR:
 1969 D.C. rape rate: 97.2 per 100,000
 1969 D.C. burglary rate: 2,869.9 per 100,000
 1969 D.C. murder rate: 36 per 100,000
 
 2007 D.C. rape rate: 32.6 per 100,000
 2007 D.C. burglary rate: 667.4 per 100,000
 2007 D.C. murder rate: 30.8 per 100,000
